content:
What are the optimal firewall settings for a production server?

Is it okay to close all ports except http/https/ssh ?
Can you tell me where in the docs you looked before asking, so we can update that place to link to the places I pointed out?
Hm, that doesn't make mention of port 22; we should probably make mention of it (at least in passing)
I wasn't refering to the docs, i mentioned those 3 since they are standard requirements

Alex Vandiver said:

https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/requirements.html#network-and-security-specifications

and, more generally,

https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/security-model.html

Thanks, I will go through this!
Googling for "Zulip firewall" takes one to that first page, so I think we're good on that working.

Alex Vandiver said:

Hm, that doesn't make mention of port 22; we should probably make mention of it (at least in passing)

Yeah, I think maybe something that conveys "Zulip doesn't use SSH, but most installations will need port 22 or another port open in order to manage the Zulip server over SSH" would be a helpful reminder.
Looks great; posted one comment but I imagine in any case we can finish this discussion in GitHub.
